metadata: (info { (description "Isafuba is a four-row mancala-style board game played in Mashonaland, Zimbabwe in the nineteenth century.") (rules "4x6-15 board. Mancala-style game. Can be played with up to ten people. ") (source "DLP evidence.") (id "1279") (version "1.3.14") (classification "board/sow/four rows/reconstruction/pending") (credit "Eric Piette") (origin "This game was played in Zimbabwe, around 1891.") } ) (graphics { (board Style Mancala) }) (recon { (concept "Sow" True) })
